title: Garden of Weeden (Original Cut) Banned on YouTube
description:
This is the raw, unfiltered truth about South Africa's underground weed culture that mainstream platforms couldn't handle. The Garden of Weeden isn't just a place; it's an experience—a world where laws are bent, secrets are currency, and survival means pushing boundaries every day. I went in deep, exposing every angle of the scene: the dealers, the growers, and the people who rely on this plant in ways most people can't imagine. This is not some pretty Instagram filter; it's gritty, real, and yes, it’s provocative.

You think you know what goes on behind the scenes? Watch this. Viewer discretion? Forget it—this isn't meant for the faint-hearted.
categories: Travel, Social Issues, Religion, Crime, Adventure

title: Walking Through Cracolândia (Unblurred Full)
description:
Cracolândia isn't just a neighborhood—it's survival on the edge. This place doesn’t follow the rules, and every step feels like stepping into a different reality. Here, addiction, poverty, and resilience collide in the harshest way. Walking these streets isn’t for the faint-hearted; it’s raw, unfiltered, and unapologetic. The people here live lives most wouldn’t dare to imagine, holding on with a strength that defies everything they face daily.

This is Brazil beyond the beaches, beyond the carnival—a place where the brutal side of life is laid bare. Viewer discretion? Forget it. This is Cracolândia, and it’s a reality check.
categories: Danger, Crime, Adventure, Humanisation, Religion

title: Cracolândia Extended Cut
description:
Cracolândia, up close and uncut. This isn’t the Brazil you see on postcards—it’s a world where the rules are survival, and every face tells a story of struggle. In these streets, people move through shadows, holding onto whatever they can to make it through one more day. It’s gritty, relentless, and anything but easy.

This extended cut goes deeper into the chaos and the resilience, showing a side of São Paulo most would rather ignore. Here, life is raw, real, and brutally honest. Cracolândia isn’t just a place; it’s a battleground, and every step feels like a test. This is as real as it gets.
categories: Culture, Religion, Interviews, Crime, Humanisation

title: Buying an African Wife (Full Negotiation)
description:
In the heart of Africa, traditions run deep, and marriage isn’t just between two people—it’s a cultural negotiation that carries generations of history and expectation. This isn’t some modern love story; it’s a complex, high-stakes exchange where every word, every gesture holds weight. What I experienced wasn’t just a conversation—it was a glimpse into a world where respect, honor, and family are everything.

This isn’t the Africa shown in travel guides. It’s real, raw, and unapologetically traditional. Here, relationships are built on values most of the world has forgotten. This is a journey into the core of culture, where love and legacy meet.
categories: Adventure, Social Issues, Documentary, Travel, Danger

title: Brazilians Try To Scam Gringo in Billiards Wager (Full Match)
description:
In São Paulo, a pool match isn’t just a game—it’s a test of skill, pride, and hustle. This isn’t your average bar table; here, every shot has a purpose, and every move tells a story. The stakes might seem small, but for the people around this table, it’s a matter of respect and reputation.

The energy is intense, and you can feel the weight of each turn, each challenge. It’s raw competition, stripped of anything fancy, where skill is the only currency that matters. This is São Paulo’s underbelly—where games aren’t just games, and every player has something to prove.
categories: Culture, Religion, Travel, Adventure, Interviews

description:
Inside São Paulo’s infamous 8-story brothel, every floor is a different world. This isn’t just a building—it’s a labyrinth of secrets, survival, and stories few dare to tell. Each level has its own hustle, its own code, and for the people here, every night is a battle to make it through. This place is raw, unapologetic, and far from glamorous.

Behind closed doors, lives intersect in ways outsiders can barely imagine, driven by necessity and resilience. It’s a side of São Paulo that goes unseen, a reality most would rather ignore. This is as real as it gets—no filters, no pretenses, just survival in its purest form.

title: Nigeria’s Black Water Slum (Full Boat Tour)
description:
Makoko, Nigeria’s floating slum, is a world built on water, where survival isn’t just a skill—it’s a necessity. Taking a boat through these narrow canals, you see a side of life that’s raw, intense, and entirely unique. People here have adapted to an environment that defies logic, creating homes and communities on the water with resilience that’s hard to imagine.

This isn’t a scenic tour; it’s a look at life where every wave, every makeshift structure is a testament to human strength and ingenuity. Makoko doesn’t fit the mold—it breaks it, showing survival at its most real and relentless. This is Makoko, unfiltered and unforgettable.
categories: Crime, Humanisation, Social Issues, Travel, Interviews

title: $3 Brothel in Nigeria Floating Slum
description:
In the depths of Nigeria’s floating slum, a hidden world thrives—a brothel unlike any other, built on water and surrounded by the struggle of everyday survival. title: France, Monaco, Italy in one Day w/Amanda
description:
Crossing France, Monaco, and Italy in a single day isn’t just a road trip—it’s a whirlwind dive through three distinct worlds, each with its own energy and intensity. With Brazilian Amanda by my side, every stop was an adventure, from the elegance of Monaco’s streets to the raw beauty of Italy’s coast. This journey wasn’t about sightseeing; it was about experiencing the heartbeat of each place in real time.

In just one day, we saw the contrasts, the culture, and the unfiltered charm of Europe. This is the kind of trip that hits fast and leaves an impact—three countries, one day, and a whole lot of unforgettable moments.
categories: Danger, Documentary, Humanisation, Culture, Adventure

title: ISIS Military Base on the Syrian Border
description:
At the Syrian-Lebanese border, lies an abandoned ISIS military base—a stark reminder of a past conflict that’s still etched into the landscape. Walking through this desolate ground, you can feel the weight of what happened here, a place once filled with the chaos of war. It’s eerie, raw, and a harsh look into the remnants of a fight that shaped the region.

This isn’t just a place; it’s a ghost of a dark time, left scarred by the intensity of battles fought and lives changed. The silence here speaks volumes, capturing the tension, the history, and the reality of a world that has seen too much.
categories: Religion, Adventure, Danger, Documentary, Interviews

title: Underground Railroad Tunnels of Mumbai
description: In this chaotic intersection in India, the beeping of horns is constant, to the point where you stop hearing it. There's no respect for traffic signals—red and green lights mean nothing, and it's every person for themselves. The noise pollution is overwhelming, far worse than New York City, and you just get used to it. The intersection itself is a free-for-all, with people and motorbikes crossing in all directions, oblivious to the chaos. This is a glimpse into the unpredictable, raw energy of everyday life in India.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Danger, Social Issues, Crime

title: Dealer Offers Me Indian Meth (Extended Cut)
description: Exploring India’s streets at 6:00 a.m., the quiet is deceptive. As the day progresses, the honking never stops, and the chaos is real. From cows walking down highways to tuk-tuk drivers sleeping in their vehicles, India is a place of contrasts. In Bandra, a high-class area, the streets are dirty, but there's a unique sense of life. People are everywhere—eating, working, or simply living on the streets. I’m navigating this maze of traffic, stray dogs, and vendors, trying street food, dodging garbage, and negotiating my way through a land of constant movement and noise. India is intense—beautiful, dirty, chaotic, and incredibly alive.
categories: Humanisation, Travel, Documentary, Exploration, Danger

title: Brazilian Tarzan Snorts Ancient Amazonian Powder
description: In São Paulo, Brazil, I’m heading to meet a jungle master who will guide me into the Amazon rainforest. After connecting with him through a friend, I arrive at his home, greeted by a traditional atmosphere filled with skulls and spiritual artifacts. We're preparing for a journey into the jungle where I'll be fully immersed in a world of nature, survival, and ancient wisdom. This trip promises to challenge me physically and mentally, pushing me into the heart of the wild, far from the comforts of the city. Let's dive into the unknown and explore this land with the guidance of someone who truly understands its depths.
categories: Danger, Crime, Travel, Adventure, Exploration

title: Sliced in the Slums of Mumbai
description: This video provides a unique glimpse into life in the slums of Mumbai, India, as the host gets a beard trim from a local barber. While the trim is happening, they discuss everything from the local hustle to the impact of methamphetamine in the area. The barber shares his experiences and dreams of owning his own shop while navigating the challenges of living in a crowded, vibrant city filled with contrasts. From the small-scale transactions in the slums to the corruption and hustle of Mumbai, this clip gives insight into the determination and resilience of people trying to make a living in tough conditions.
categories: Humanisation, Exploration, Travel, Religion, Danger

title: Slave labor leather factories of Dharavi, India
description: In the slums of Mumbai, the narrator explores leather factories where workers cut leather by hand, earning about $5 a day for 8-10 hours of work. The factories, operating in harsh conditions, recycle plastic and leather into products for local markets. Despite the grueling work, there's no time for complaining; survival is prioritized. The video emphasizes the resilience of people working in dire conditions and reflects on the contrast between their hard lives and viewers' more comfortable realities, urging appreciation for what one has.
categories: Social Issues, Interviews, Travel, Adventure, Documentary

title: The Rat Poison Slum of Andheridongar, India
description: The streets of Mumbai reveal a raw reality, where life is lived in the open, with people working, playing, and surviving on every corner. The host and his guide, Shadik, navigate through local slums, encountering everything from street vendors to kids with big dreams. They talk about the impact of drugs, gang violence, and the resilience of people facing harsh conditions. The experience offers a glimpse into daily life, exploring topics like dating, family, and the hustle that keeps these communities going despite everything.
categories: Religion, Culture, Social Issues, Travel, Interviews

title: The Trash People of Dharavi, India
description: In the heart of the bustling streets, the host navigates through Mumbai's slums, showcasing the raw realities of life in these communities. They explore the local markets, recycling businesses, and plastic factories where workers earn a mere $5 a day, dealing with hospital waste and harsh conditions. Amidst the filth and poverty, there's a spirit of resilience, but also a looming danger from the drug trade and gangs. As the sun sets, the host reflects on the disparity between the life they're filming and the comfort many take for granted, emphasizing the harsh truths of daily survival in the slums.
categories: Culture, Danger, Religion, Exploration, Social Issues

title: the Indian Meth Addicts Who live Under a Pipe
description: Ever wonder what life is like for the people society tends to forget? I found myself face-to-face with a community of meth addicts living under a pipe, and their stories are as raw as it gets. This isn’t your typical documentary—no filters, no scripts, just a reality check on how brutal life can turn when you’re on the edge. These people, fighting demons most of us can’t even imagine, gave me a glimpse into a life that most look away from. It’s gritty, uncomfortable, and absolutely real. title: Dubai’s $10,000,000 Secret Counterfeit Markets [Part 1]
description: Deep in the heart of Dubai, beyond the glitz and glamour, lies a $10,000,000 secret—its massive counterfeit markets. This isn’t the Dubai you see in travel ads; it’s a hidden world where knock-offs and fakes reign supreme. From luxury bags to high-end electronics, everything’s on display in these underground markets, where the stakes are high and business is booming. This journey peels back the layers on a side of Dubai built on deception and hustle, revealing a reality that’s as surprising as it is raw. Prepare to see Dubai like never before.
categories: Crime, Travel, Humanisation, Danger, Religion

title: Day 4 of Living with the Cartel [Sicario Jungle Interview]
description: Inside the depths of the cartel’s online network lies a world few can imagine—a web of encrypted transactions, hidden codes, and a ruthless drive to stay undetected. This isn’t just a website; it’s a whole underground ecosystem built to fuel organized crime while dodging the spotlight. Every layer peeled back reveals calculated moves, tactics, and a commitment to secrecy that keeps this operation alive. It’s a raw, unfiltered look at the digital underworld, where danger lurks behind every click and trust is nonexistent.
categories: Crime, Exploration, Adventure, Social Issues, Travel

title: Inside the Most Armed City in America
description: Out in the vast, rugged landscape of Texas, there’s a world of grit and raw survival that goes beyond the movies. This isn’t just any range—it’s a place where the rules are simple, but life isn’t. From wide-open spaces to the intense culture of the people who live here, every moment is filled with a fierce, unfiltered reality. It’s Texas stripped down, where resilience is a way of life, and every encounter feels larger than life. Get ready to see the Texas range in all its untamed, authentic glory.
categories: Exploration, Religion, Travel, Social Issues, Humanisation

title: Inside The Most Satanic City in America
description: Los Angeles—a city where dreams and reality collide in unexpected ways. Beneath the glamour lies a raw, unfiltered side, filled with people hustling to make it, each with their own story. This journey through LA reveals a mix of ambition, struggle, and resilience that’s hard to find anywhere else. From hidden corners to bustling streets, every encounter shows a different layer of the city that rarely gets the spotlight. This is Los Angeles beyond the bright lights, where life is as real as it gets.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Social Issues, Interviews, Travel

title: SKID ROW | America’s Land of Zombies
description: Welcome to Skid Row, America’s forgotten land, where the streets are lined with stories of hardship, addiction, and survival. This isn’t just a neighborhood—it’s a stark reality check, where people live on the edge, day in and day out. The scene feels like a different world, a place where society’s outcasts create a life among the chaos. Here, you see the human cost of a system that’s left so many behind. It’s raw, intense, and haunting—a look into the harsh reality of America’s “land of zombies.”
categories: Culture, Humanisation, Social Issues, Adventure, Crime

title: The Secret Society Underneath Las Vegas
description: Beneath the glitz of Las Vegas lies a hidden world—a secret underground society that most people would never believe exists. Away from the bright lights and casinos, there’s a community living in the shadows, navigating a reality shaped by survival and secrecy. This isn’t the Vegas you know; it’s a side of the city where life is raw, intense, and unforgiving. It’s a glimpse into a hidden layer of society that stays out of sight but has stories that are as real as they come. Get ready to see Vegas like never before.
categories: Interviews, Adventure, Travel, Social Issues, Documentary

title: Hunting For Desert Pirates in The Sahara
description: In the vast emptiness of the Sahara, a hidden threat lurks—desert pirates who roam the sands, living by their own rules. This isn’t a typical adventure; it’s a dangerous journey into one of the most unforgiving landscapes on earth, where survival skills are tested to the limit. Out here, every encounter holds risk, and the relentless heat only adds to the intensity. This is a raw look at life in the Sahara, where the lines between hunter and hunted blur, and the rules of the desert are all that matter.
categories: Crime, Culture, Documentary, Humanisation, Religion

title: 102 Minutes of Jamaicans Scamming Me
description: This is 102 minutes of nonstop hustle, where Jamaican scammers pull out every trick in the book to get what they want. From smooth talk to high-pressure tactics, they’re relentless, showing just how skilled they are at their craft. It’s a raw look at a world where persuasion is an art, and every call is a game of cat and mouse. This isn’t just a call; it’s a deep dive into the reality of scamming, where the stakes are high, and every second counts. Get ready for an intense ride through the mind games and manipulation that fuel this underground economy.
categories: Social Issues, Crime, Exploration, Culture, Travel

title: Arab Becomes a Jamaican Rasta
description: Stepping into the vibrant world of Jamaican Rasta culture, I didn’t just observe—I became a part of it. From the rhythms of reggae to the deep-rooted philosophies of Rastafari, this experience was about more than just appearance; it was a dive into a way of life. Surrounded by the spirit of unity, peace, and strength, I embraced the energy and mindset that make the Rasta lifestyle so powerful. This isn’t just a look—it’s a transformation that shows the true essence of Jamaican culture.
categories: Religion, Crime, Humanisation, Documentary, Interviews

title: Inside Jamaica’s Most Dangerous Hood – Tivoli Gardens
description: In the heart of Jamaica’s most dangerous hood, life is intense, raw, and filled with stories of survival. This isn’t the Jamaica you see on postcards; it’s a side where respect is everything, and every day is a test of resilience. Walking these streets, you feel the weight of a community shaped by hardship and strength, where every face tells a story. It’s a gritty reality, far from the beaches and resorts, showing the real struggles and the spirit that keeps this neighborhood alive. Prepare to see Jamaica like never before.
categories: Documentary, Humanisation, Exploration, Culture, Crime

title: Gun to My Head in Egyptian Slums (REMOVED from YouTube)
description: In the unforgiving slums of Egypt, every step feels like a gamble. This isn’t the Egypt you see in travel guides—it’s a raw, intense world where survival is the only rule. With a gun to my head, I faced the harsh reality of life on the edge, where every encounter carries weight and every moment is unpredictable. This experience strips away the illusions, showing the true grit and resilience of people who live in these conditions every day. Get ready for an unfiltered look at the side of Egypt most would never dare to see.
categories: Social Issues, Exploration, Adventure, Interviews, Travel

title: I Spent 17 Days Kidnapped in Haiti [Interview w/Negotiator]
description: Seventeen days kidnapped in Haiti—a reality that most can’t imagine, but one that reveals the raw and terrifying side of survival. In this interview, I dive deep with the negotiator who worked to secure my release, uncovering the intense world of hostage situations, high-stakes negotiations, and life on the line. Every moment felt like a lifetime, each decision carrying unimaginable weight. This is a story of resilience, fear, and the lengths people go to in a world where trust is scarce and survival is everything.
categories: Exploration, Travel, Crime, Interviews, Adventure

title: Shot at in São Paulo’s Most Dangerous Favela (Removed from YouTube)
description: In the heart of São Paulo’s most dangerous favela, survival is a daily battle, and danger is around every corner. Getting shot at here isn’t just a possibility; it’s a harsh reality that many face. This isn’t the polished view of Brazil—it’s raw, chaotic, and intense, where every moment is a test of courage. Walking these streets shows a side of São Paulo that most people wouldn’t dare to explore, where life is lived on the edge, and every day brings new challenges. Prepare to see Brazil stripped down to its grittiest form.
categories: Exploration, Culture, Religion, Humanisation, Danger

title: I Spent 17 Days Kidnapped in Haiti [PART 1]
description: Seventeen days held captive in Haiti—a journey into fear, resilience, and survival in its rawest form. This isn’t just a story; it’s a firsthand account of what it feels like when every second is borrowed time. In Part 1, I share the beginning of a nightmare that pushed me to my limits, navigating the harsh reality of life in captivity. Each day was a fight to stay calm, to stay alive, and to hold onto hope in a place where hope seemed impossible. This is survival, stripped down to its most intense, unfiltered form.
categories: Danger, Culture, Religion, Travel, Documentary

title: Kidnappers Scam $600K & Keep Me Hostage [PART 3]
description: Held hostage while my kidnappers scam $600K—a situation that’s as intense as it sounds. In Part 3, the stakes reach a breaking point, with every moment spent wondering if I’d make it out alive. This isn’t just about money; it’s a twisted game of power and fear where each decision could mean life or death. The constant pressure, the psychological warfare, and the uncertainty make every second feel like an eternity. This is a raw look at survival in the face of relentless danger and deception, where trust doesn’t exist and escape seems impossible.
categories: Humanisation, Travel, Adventure, Social Issues, Danger

title: Arrested & Extorted for $10,000 in Haiti [PART 4] [EXTENDED]
description: Arrested and extorted for $10,000 in Haiti—a brutal reality check in a place where corruption runs deep. This wasn’t just a random encounter; it was a relentless experience where power and greed took control. Facing officials who bend the rules for their gain, every moment was a test of endurance, forcing me to navigate a world where justice has a price. This extended cut dives into the intensity of a system that operates in shadows, revealing the raw truth of survival in an unforgiving environment.
categories: Interviews, Humanisation, Religion, Danger, Culture

title: Cock Fights to the DEATH in DR
description: In the Dominican Republic, cockfighting isn’t just a sport—it’s a fierce, deadly battle where survival is on the line. These aren’t casual matches; they’re brutal fights to the death, fueled by adrenaline and intense rivalries. The crowd roars, betting runs high, and each fight is a raw display of aggression and strategy. This isn’t the side of the DR you’ll see in travel guides; it’s a glimpse into a world where tradition, pride, and intensity collide. Prepare to witness the unfiltered reality of a culture where every fight is a fight to the end.
categories: Documentary, Travel, Exploration, Culture, Social Issues

title: Inside the Smuggling Tunnels of the Dominican Republic
description: In the roughest neighborhood of the Dominican Republic, street fights are a brutal part of everyday life. This isn’t just about anger; it’s survival, respect, and a way to settle scores where the rules are raw and unforgiving. The intensity is palpable, with each fight revealing a reality that most people wouldn’t dare to face. This is the DR’s grittiest side, where life on the edge is a constant battle, and every confrontation holds the weight of survival. Get ready to see the streets of the Dominican Republic in their most unfiltered form.
categories: Religion, Crime, Travel, Humanisation, Danger

title: Escaping Trinidad to Venezuela with my Brazilian Chick
description: Escaping to Trinidad and then on to Venezuela with a Brazilian chick—this journey was anything but ordinary. Crossing borders, navigating risky paths, and facing the unexpected, every moment was charged with thrill and uncertainty. This wasn’t just a getaway; it was an adventure filled with intensity, close calls, and the kind of experiences you can’t script. From the vibrant streets of Trinidad to the raw edge of Venezuela, this trip tested our nerve and pushed us to the limit. Buckle up for a wild ride across borders.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Travel, Social Issues, Religion

title: Arab’s First Trip after the Kidnapping – FILTHY RICH
description: On my first trip since the kidnapping, stepping back into the world felt surreal. This time, I’m diving into the world of the filthy rich, surrounded by luxury that’s worlds apart from what I just endured. It’s a stark contrast—going from survival mode to witnessing opulence on another level. Every encounter feels sharper, every moment more intense, as I navigate this high-stakes environment with a new perspective. This journey is about more than wealth; it’s a raw reminder of how quickly life can flip, from danger to decadence.
categories: Adventure, Interviews, Travel, Danger, Documentary

title: Skydiving w/Luke Belmar – FILTHY RICH #2
description: Jumping out of a plane with Luke Belmar, we took on skydiving as more than just an adrenaline rush—it’s a test of guts and mindset. This isn’t just about the thrill; it’s about pushing limits, taking risks, and experiencing the freedom that comes from diving headfirst into the unknown. Being up there, freefalling, is like facing any high-stakes decision where you either go all in or don’t go at all. With Luke by my side, this jump wasn’t just an adventure—it was a lesson in living life on the edge.
categories: Interviews, Crime, Travel, Exploration, Adventure

title: Inside the World’s Deadliest Racetrack [Extended Cut]
description: Welcome to the most dangerous racetrack in the world, where speed, risk, and adrenaline collide at every turn. This isn’t your average race—it’s a test of skill, guts, and survival, where the margin for error is razor-thin. The track is unforgiving, and the stakes are sky-high as drivers push their limits at breakneck speeds. From heart-stopping near-misses to intense moments of pure focus, this is racing in its rawest, most intense form. Get ready to witness the thrill and danger of the world’s most lethal racetrack up close.
categories: Exploration, Religion, Travel, Interviews, Culture

title: I Investigated Europe’s Zombie Train Station [Extended Cut]
description: Inside the drug addiction capital of Europe, the streets are a haunting reflection of a crisis that’s spiraled out of control. This isn’t just about addiction; it’s a brutal look at the human toll, where survival becomes the only focus. The people here live in a world where hope is hard to find, and every day is a struggle just to get by. From the dark corners of the city to the faces of those trapped in addiction, this is a raw, unfiltered look at the realities of one of Europe’s most devastating epidemics. Prepare for a journey through a world many choose to ignore.

title: The German City with NO LAWS
description: In this German park, where drugs are legally sold and consumed, the boundaries of what’s acceptable are pushed to the extreme. It’s a surreal place where society’s usual rules don’t apply, and people walk freely through a haze of smoke, exploring the limits of freedom and addiction. This park isn’t just about legality—it’s about the culture that’s formed around it, where everything is laid bare in a mix of curiosity, chaos, and consequence. Step into a world where the line between freedom and danger blurs, revealing a side of society few ever experience.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Interviews, Danger, Social Issues

title: Arab Does Drugs in Amsterdam
description: In Amsterdam, the rules are different, and the experience is raw and unfiltered. I took a deep dive into the city’s drug culture, where everything is on display, and freedom takes on a new meaning. This isn’t just about substances; it’s about seeing how people live within a system where drugs are normalized and regulated. From the calm streets to the chaos of the nightlife, Amsterdam’s drug scene tells a story of indulgence, consequences, and a unique sense of liberty. Get ready for an unfiltered look into a world that many only hear about.
categories: Adventure, Humanisation, Exploration, Culture, Religion

title: I Took SNEAKO to a Warzone [YouTube Cut]
description: I took Sneako to a warzone—an experience that pushed us both to the limits. This isn’t just about chaos; it’s about confronting the raw reality of conflict, danger, and survival. As we navigated through one of the world’s most volatile regions, we saw firsthand the resilience of the people who live through it every day. From the constant threat of violence to the unshakable spirit of those who endure, this journey showed us a side of the world most only see in the news. It’s raw, intense, and unforgettable.

title: Inside Portugal’s Most Dangerous Hood w/SNEAKO
description: Inside Portugal’s most dangerous hood, Cova de Moura, life is lived on the edge. This isn’t a place for the faint of heart—it’s a raw, unfiltered world where survival comes first, and every corner hides a new challenge. From the intense tension in the streets to the resilience of the people who call it home, Cova de Moura shows what happens when poverty and struggle collide. It’s a world where danger is constant, and trust is hard to come by. Get ready for an eye-opening journey into one of Europe’s toughest neighborhoods.
categories: Social Issues, Crime, Adventure, Danger, Humanisation

title: Finding a Virgin Wife in Catholic Portugal
description: In the heart of Catholic Europe, I set out on a journey to find a virgin wife, navigating the cultural complexities and traditions that define this deeply rooted society. It’s more than just a quest for love—it’s an exploration of values, expectations, and the intersection of faith and relationships in a place where history shapes everything. From old-world customs to modern-day challenges, this journey takes a closer look at what it means to search for purity in a world that’s changing fast. Get ready for an unfiltered dive into love, tradition, and faith in one of Europe’s most conservative regions.
categories: Exploration, Crime, Adventure, Culture, Social Issues

title: Fighting a Homeless in Barcelona’s Barrios
description: In one of Spain’s most dangerous neighborhoods, things took an unexpected turn when a crackhead tried to fight me. This is a place where survival is a daily struggle, and conflict is always on the horizon. The streets are filled with tension, desperation, and raw energy, where the line between calm and chaos is razor-thin. Every encounter feels like it could escalate, and this one was no different. It’s an unfiltered look at life in a tough part of Spain, where every moment holds the potential for danger, but also a glimpse into the resilience of those who live there.
categories: Culture, Social Issues, Adventure, Religion, Exploration

title: Solo in Spain’s Gothic Hoods
description: Solo in Spain’s Gothic hoods, I found myself navigating the narrow, dark streets where history and danger collide. These neighborhoods are filled with hidden stories, ancient buildings, and a sense of isolation that feels almost alive. As I walked through the gothic maze, I encountered a side of Spain that most people never see—the raw energy, the tension, and the resilience of those who live in the shadows. It’s a world where every corner holds a mystery, and every step brings you closer to the gritty heart of the city. Get ready for a journey through Spain’s most intense and haunting neighborhoods.
categories: Interviews, Social Issues, Humanisation, Religion, Culture

title: 1st Time Taking Shrooms w/Luke Belmar in Ibiza
description: Taking shrooms with Luke Belmar, we stepped into a mind-bending experience where reality and perception collide. This isn’t just about the trip—it’s about exploring the depths of consciousness, questioning everything, and embracing a new perspective on life. With every moment, the world around us shifted, revealing new layers of thought and connection. Luke and I ventured deep into the psychedelic, challenging the way we see the world and ourselves. It’s a raw, unfiltered look at the power of psychedelics and the profound effects they can have on the mind.
categories: Crime, Social Issues, Religion, Travel, Humanisation

title: The Secret Knowledge Vortex the Elites are Hiding From You
description: The Secret Knowledge Vortex—the elites are hiding something, and this journey takes you right to the heart of it. This isn’t just about conspiracy theories; it’s about uncovering the hidden truths that powerful people don’t want you to know. From ancient knowledge to modern-day secrets, this dive reveals the systems, agendas, and information that are kept from the public eye. The more we dig, the more we uncover—a world of hidden power, control, and manipulation. Get ready for an eye-opening journey into the knowledge they don’t want you to have.
categories: Danger, Religion, Travel, Documentary, Interviews

title: Avoiding Gunfire on Lebanon’s Border
description: In Tripoli, Lebanon, the streets are filled with tension and danger, where gunfire can erupt at any moment. Avoiding it isn’t just about luck; it’s about understanding the pulse of the city and staying alert in a place where conflict is never far away. As I navigated through the chaos, the sounds of gunshots and the threat of violence were constant reminders of the harsh reality faced by the people living there. This is an unfiltered look at survival in a city on the edge, where every step could lead you into the line of fire.
categories: Humanisation, Social Issues, Exploration, Culture, Religion

title: I Spent a Day with Lebanon’s Religious ‘Extremists’ [UNCENSORED]
description: In Lebanon, a religious cult stands as a powerful force, protecting its own while influencing the course of the country’s future. This isn’t just about belief; it’s about a community that has woven itself into the fabric of Lebanon’s history, politics, and survival. From their secretive practices to their unwavering loyalty, this cult operates in the shadows, shaping the direction of a nation. This journey takes you inside their world, revealing the power structures, rituals, and secrets that keep them hidden yet influential. Get ready for an unfiltered look at a force that’s protecting Lebanon in ways most never see.
categories: Danger, Interviews, Documentary, Crime, Social Issues

title: I Fought Triads in the Streets of Taiwan
description: In the streets of Taiwan, I found myself face-to-face with the Triads, one of the most notorious crime syndicates in the world. This isn’t just a fight—it’s a battle for survival in a city where the underworld operates in the shadows, and every confrontation holds life-or-death stakes. From the adrenaline-pumping chaos to the raw intensity of the encounter, this is a real, unfiltered look at what it’s like when you’re caught in the crossfire of organized crime. The streets of Taiwan may seem peaceful, but beneath the surface, danger is never far away.
categories: Religion, Culture, Crime, Interviews, Danger

title: Hindu Guru Destroys Christianity
description: In this encounter with a spiritual guru, the discussion takes a sharp turn as he challenges and deconstructs Christianity with bold arguments and deep philosophical insights. This isn’t just a debate; it’s an intense exploration of spiritual beliefs, where the guru’s perspective shakes the foundations of traditional Christian teachings. As we dive into the heart of his critique, it becomes clear that this is a clash of ideologies—where ancient wisdom confronts modern faith. Get ready for a thought-provoking look at religion, belief, and the power of questioning everything.
categories: Adventure, Religion, Danger, Social Issues, Exploration
